articleContent.title: Chord: sus2 in C# (Shape: G)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: sus2 in C# (Shape: G)

## Brief Overview
The sus2 chord is a triad with an added major 2nd interval above the root note. In this case, the sus2 chord in the key of C# (using the G shape on the guitar) consists of the notes C# (root), D# (major 2nd), and G# (perfect 5th). This chord creates a dreamy and open sound which can provide a sense of tension and release in music.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root: C#
- Major 2nd: D#
- Perfect 5th: G#

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The sus2 chord is often used in genres like pop, folk, and indie music to add a sense of ethereal or melancholic quality to the sound. It has a kind of "floaty" feeling that can evoke emotions such as longing or introspection. The use of the sus2 chord can help to create a more harmonically rich and dynamic musical landscape.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the sus2 chord in C# (Shape: G):
1. "Blackbird" by The Beatles
2. "Dust in the Wind" by Kansas
3. "Wish You Were Here" by Pink Floyd
